articles.author: Aya Elamroussi, CNN
articles.title: Covid-19 antiviral pill could be a game changer, but vaccines are still America's way out of the pandemic, experts say - CNN
articles.description: A pill that could potentially treat Covid-19 is a "game-changer," but experts are emphasizing that it's not an alternative to vaccinations -- which remain the most effective path to ending the coronavirus pandemic if enough people get their shots.

articles.title: U.S. hits 700000 COVID deaths just as cases begin to fall - NPR
articles.description: Health experts say the latest wave of the pandemic has peaked. But an estimated 70 million eligible Americans remain unvaccinated and vulnerable to the highly contagious delta variant.

articles.title: Former Vancouver mayor Philip Owen dead at 88 - CBC.ca
articles.description: Philip Owen is perhaps best known for championing the “four pillars” drug strategy for Vancouver, which led to the city having North America’s first legal supervised injection site.
articles.content:
Philip Owen, who was mayor of Vancouver from 1993 to 2002, has died at the age of 88.
Owen was a councillor and park board commissioner before becoming mayor, and served for nine years, the third lo… [+2982 chars]

articles.title: S Korea broadband firm sues Netflix after traffic surge from 'Squid Game' - CNA
articles.description:
SEOUL: South Korean Internet service provider SK Broadband has sued Netflix to pay for costs from increased network traffic and maintenance work because of a surge of viewers to the American firm's content, an SK spokesperson said on Friday (Oct 1).

The mo…
articles.content:
Last year, Netflix had brought its own lawsuit on whether it had any obligation to pay SK for network usage, arguing that Netflix's duty ends with creating content and leaving it accessible.
